translated: The Mansion on the Mountain
The Male Spirit’s Mansion
The Great Charioteers
The Second Mansion of the Elephant
“Having mounted a great elephant,
a supreme white elephant,🔽you go from forest to forest,
attended by a group of women,
illuminating all directions,
like a medicinal herb, a star.
What is the cause of your beauty?

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and your beauty shines in all directions?”🔽Pleased with the question,
the god,

analyzed: vaṅgīsena iva pucchitaḥ  pañham puṭṭhaḥ viyākāsi
translated: answered the question,
saying, “This is the result of that action.”
“When I was a human being,
I was a lay follower of the Buddha.
I refrained from killing living beings
and avoided taking what was not given in the world.

original: Amajjapo no ca musā abhāṇiṁ,🔽Sakena dārena ca tuṭṭho ahosiṁ;🔽Annañca pānañca pasannacitto,
analyzed: na u ca musāḥ  sakena dārena ca tuṭṭhaḥ ahosi  annam ca pānam ca pasanna cittaḥ
translated: I did not drink alcohol or tell lies.🔽I was content with my own wife.🔽With a serene mind, I gave food and drink.
I gave a generous gift with my own hands.
Because of that, I have this beauty.

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and my beauty shines in all directions.”
The Second Mansion of the Elephant, the eleventh.
